title: Support for Firefox 115 ESR ends in March 2025 - right?
content:
Hello everyone!

On 10/3/24 Mozilla wrote in a KB: "Mozilla will provide security updates for Firefox 115 ESR until at least March 2025, when the position will be re-evaluated."

According to "https://data.firefox.com/dashboard/hardware", over 7.5% of Firefox users are currently using Windows 7. Will Mozilla extend the end of support for 115 ESR again or will it end next month?

Thanks and regards, Martin

title: Friefox 115.20.0esr WIN7 vs Ubuntu
content:
OK seems mozilla will continue support for firefox 115.20.0esr on my WIN7 machine, but not my 115.20.0esr on my Ubuntu 24.04lts machine after next month - why? (128esr and 135 are both unstable on my laptop's Ubuntu 24.04.2lts for some reason - constantly crashes, freezes up req. cold boot, or just logs me out - pain in the... even after upgrading 2Gb RAM to 4Gb)

OK seems I can upgrade (don't know why they keep calling it 'update') my Ubunut 24.04lts machine's firefox 115.20.0esr to firefox 128.3.0esr, but not on my WIN7 machine -why?

i.e. why does firefox give preferential treatment to WIN7 for 115esr, and preferential treatment to LINUX for 128esr ... why not both OS's on both "esr's"

...makes me go: hmmmmmm ;-\

title: Why is my website loading slowly or not responding at all? | https://gmsecurityservices.co.uk |
content:
I run a security company in London that provides security guards and related services. Our website is crucial for attracting new clients, handling inquiries, and showcasing our services. However, we’ve recently noticed that the site has become very slow to load and, at times, completely unresponsive.

At first, I thought it was a temporary issue, but it has persisted for several days. Some visitors have reported that the website takes too long to load, while others say they receive error messages or SSL warnings. Since our business relies on the website for leads and customer engagement, this is a serious concern.

What I Have Checked So Far: 

Verified that our hosting provider is operational

Cleared the website cache and restarted the server Scanned for malware or security breaches Checked that our SSL certificate is valid Tested the website on different devices and networks

I’m unsure whether this is due to server problems, high traffic, a DDoS attack, or a misconfiguration in our website settings. Has anyone experienced something similar? Could this be a DNS issue, firewall restriction, or a hosting-related problem? Any troubleshooting advice or solutions would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your help! https://gmsecurityservices.co.uk/
creator: GMSSuk100

title: problems with router settings page
content:
Im not sure when the issue first started as Firefox updates quite often. Here is the issue: When logging into my router settings page locally,(http://xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx to access router on network), the forms constantly overlap. For example there is a form on the left that shows each settings page and the form on the right which is the settings i currently have selected.

When each settings form is loaded it is overlapped by the form on the right. To fix it i zoom in or out. And the forms re-align. But then they almost immediately snap back making it almost impossible to enter any data. This has not been an issue in the past, but i havent had to adjust my router setting for a while. It's driving me insane, so much that i installed a chrome browser just to access my router info. But i would prefer to use firefox as i do not like chrome.

This is also on both an old install and a brand new install of windows 10 and new install of firefox.

The router is a c4000bg from centurylink.

Thank you for any assistance in the matter.

title: Cherry Picking Nightly Feature into Stable
content:
Greetings

It has been 5 years since Chrome introduced tab grouping. Meanwhile, the devs decided to start working on AI instead of getting this done ASAP. My workflow is completely dependent on Firefox so I can't simply change to another browser, the extensions available are not useful for me and I really miss this feature. Since this feature appeared on Nightly I've installed it and my experience just got a lot better, however, Nightly is just too unstable for me. Therefore, is there any way that I can cherry pick from Nightly this one feature that's totally working to my stable Firefox build through the browser itself without having to go to git/source code?

I really wouldn't like to wait another don't know how many years so they can get this done. I guess that my question would also be useful for other features that people are interested, that were already developed and that haven't been released yet.
creator: leadclow

Is this a known error and is there a potential fix? I thought this was a good security feature.

title: Não consigo instalar a extensão kapersky password manager
content:
Boa tarde, gostaria de saber se a extensão kapersky password manager ainda é compatível com o navegador firefox, pois não estou conseguindo instalar a extensão, a página fica em branco quando tento fazer pelo software da kapersky e não aparece como opção quando busco no firefox Eu utilizava esta extensão normalmente no meu computador até fazer uma instalação nova do windows em janeiro/2025 e desde daí não consigo mais Entrei em contato com o suporte da kapersky e a resposta basicamente foi reinstalar os dois programas e vê se resolvia o que não resolveu Resposta final da kapersky "Na verdade, não existe nenhuma incompatibilidade e nenhum problema para instalar a extensão do Kaspersky Password Manager no Mozilla. Não é um comportamento que está se repetindo em outros dispositivos ou com outros clientes. Foram feitos testes internos também e tudo correu como esperado. Mas compreendo que isso esteja acontecendo no seu dispositivo e estemos aqui para solucionar esse problema."

Por favor me ajudem, não quero continuar usando o Edge e nem ter que instalar o chrome

Obrigado

title: All external links open in the same tab.
content:
I want links that I open (in Firefox, from Firefox, like opening any normal link) to open in the same tab (unless otherwise specific, like a normal browser should work), and all links from other applications to open in a new tab.

Whenever I click a link, it overrides my current tab, even if I'm working on something important. Apps do not always make it obvious what might be a URL. Windows for instance LOVES to open up "support" links in your browser. Firefox also does this itself with its update function, it opens up its update notification by overwriting your previous tab.

This is a really, really basic feature that should really be a default setting, but it doesn't seem to exist in settings at all.
